newsitem.title: UK: UK/Canada corporate finance link up for small co's.
newsitem.headline: UK/Canada corporate finance link up for small co's.

text.p: Two corporate finance companies in Britain and Canada have linked up to help raise and direct financing for small and medium sized businesses.

Corfin UK and Garwood Financial Ltd, based in Ontario, have formed Garwood Corfin, which will specialise in raising between 500,000 stg and 5.0 million stg for growing enterprises, and helping them prepare for listing on the Alternative Investment Market (AIM) in Britain or Nasdaq in the U.S, which accounts for more than half of all the shares traded in the U.S. each day.
"Garwood Corfin will provide a turnkey service which includes, uniquely, the payment of all costs," said Richard Stanton-Reid, managing director of the new company.

Corfin has a close association with the Independent Financial Partnership (IFP), the largest independent financial advisor in the north of England, and from whom Corfin acquired their capital raising division.
IFP will continue to provide services to individual investors, leaving Corfin and Garwood Corfin to concentrate on client companies.
